title: A1990 820-01814 stuck at 5v no current draw
message:
Got an A1990 820-01814 which is stuck at 5V with no current draw. Occasionally it does switch to 20v and also with no current draw and no power but i havent seen it do that very often!

It was slightly liquid damaged around JB200 and C9080 - i've cleaned up both areas and no issues there, have also run it through the ultrasonic just to catch anything I didn't see. 

PPBUS is not shorted to ground and is reading 0.8v when it's stuck at 5v. 
PP3V3_G3H is missing and also not shorted to ground.

Following the CD3215 bootup sequence at u3200 I have:
PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS  5v
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO 3.3v
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA 1.8v
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD 1.8v
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC 0.1v

So it seems to be getting stuck at reading the thunderbolt rom. All four ports on the macbook behave the same!

What would the next step at this point be?

title: A1990 820-01814 stuck at 5v no current draw
message:
Did you check diode mode to ground at PPBUS_G3H?
Compare with the readings on all big coils; don't forget L9080/580.

Remove F7000/1 and check C7050 voltage.

title: A1990 820-01814 stuck at 5v no current draw
message:
Diode Mode to ground on 
PPBUS_G3H - 0.398
L9080 - 0.371
L9580 - not present on this board
None of the other coils read anywhere near the same reading and I did already check if any of them were shorted to PPBUS_G3H previously (Forgot to mention)

After removing F7000 and F7001 and i'm getting C7050 voltage at 12.3V

title: A1990 820-01814 stuck at 5v no current draw
message:
So you have problems with a secondary power supply.

Corrosion near C9080 may be sign of damaged SSD.
What is resistance (ohm scale) between PPBUS_G3H and L9080?

title: A1990 820-01814 stuck at 5v no current draw
message:
Well we can put this one as solved - U9080 had a tiny bit of corrosion underneath which after removing, cleaning and fitting a new IC has resolved the issue.

Thank you for the pointers in the right direction! Luckily the SSD has survived this stupid design by apple to put this controller so close to the edge of the board!
